text: is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator, based in Los Angeles. == Biography == Yutaka is an alumnus of the Senzoku Gakuen College of Music in Japan, where he studied musical composition under Toshiyuki Watanabe and Masataka Matsuo.洗足学園音楽大学I 音楽・音響デザインコース 卒業生情報 山田豊（2011年卒業） Senzoku Gakuen College of Music. Retrieved September 5, 2018 Yutaka has written scores for more than 40 projects, including the anime series "Tokyo Ghoul",TVアニメ『東京喰種トーキョーグール』Staff&Cast; TV anime Tokyo Ghoul Official Website. Retrieved September 5, 2018 Japanese TV series "Marumo no Okite" ("Marumo's Rule") and a number of TV commercials such as "Audi", "Samsung Galaxy" and "Georgia (Coca-Cola)". Yutaka's work on Tokyo Ghoul attracted public attention shortly after its release in 2014.Música: Tokyo Ghoul Symphonie de Yutaka Yamada El Antro de los Vampiros y Otros Monstruos. Retrieved September 5, 2018 Its original soundtrack, which includes the main theme song "Glassy Sky (sung by Donna Burke)", gained popularity and has over 50,000,000 views on YouTube. In 2018, Eminem sampled "Glassy Sky" on the track "Good Guy" from his "Kamikaze" album.Eminem’s “Good Guy” Samples Japanese Anime Composer Yutaka Yamada Genius.com. Retrieved September 5, 2018 Yutaka has continued to produce popular music in collaboration with vocalists, including the tracks "Never Let Me Go (sung by Julia Shortreed)" and "Take My Hand (Sung by NIKIIE)", both of which were ranked No. 1 on iTunes chart in Japan.オリコンニュースIドラマ『わたしを離さないで』話題の劇中歌を配信. Oricon News. Retrieved September 5, 2018 In 2017, Yutaka relocated to Los Angeles and began working with Soundtrack Music Associates for representation.Profile of Yutaka Yamada yutakayamada.com.
